intro: Phlomoides mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian phlomoides, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Phlomoides mongolica is often found in steppe and desert steppe ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
